common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.0.0 Performance Issues and Bugs
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with Pieces OS 11.0.0, including Claude 3.5 Sonnet Copilot errors, Long-Term Memory (LTM) engine malfunctions, and overall performance degradation.  Suggested workarounds include switching to OpenAI or Gemini models, ensuring Pieces Ecosystem login, and updating to the latest patch (11.0.1). Pieces team is actively investigating and addressing these issues.

2. Ensure you sign in to the Pieces Ecosystem, this will ensure that you have a larger rate limit than those users who are NOT authenticated.

Please feel free to comment in this thread if you are experiencing similar issues!

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** Long-Term Memory (LTM) Engine not turning on in Pieces app.

**Key points raised:**

* User reports LTM Engine not turning on.
* User provides a video demonstrating the issue.
* Multiple users confirm experiencing the same problem.
* User provides logs after request from Pieces support.

**Problems identified:**

* Downloaded local LLM overrides saved selected model, preventing LTM from turning on.
* After update, LTM still not enabled for some users.
* Browser page opens with message "Woohoo PiecesOS 11.0 is released 🎉" after each reboot.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces support team investigated the issue and identified the root cause.
* A patch was released on December 19th, 2024 to fix the LTM overriding issue.
* Pieces support team released version 11.0.1 of PiecesOS and 3.3.1 of the Desktop application on December 20th, 2024 with further updates.

**Current status/outcome:**

* It is unclear whether the latest update fully resolved the LTM issue for all users.
* Some users continue to report problems with LTM not enabling after the update.
* Issue remains open and under investigation by Pieces support team.

**Additional notes:**

* User provided logs and a video to assist with troubleshooting.
* Pieces support team was responsive and provided updates on the progress.
* Issue appears to be complex and may require further investigation and updates.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues in VS Code
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from the VS Code extension, particularly within remote development environments like Docker containers.  This is often due to firewall restrictions or the extension's inability to detect the Pieces OS instance. Solutions include configuring custom URLs in the extension settings, ensuring firewall access, and restarting Pieces OS.

related_issues.title: Can't connect from dev container
related_issues.text: Can't connect from dev container ### Software Pieces OS, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 9.0.7 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. # Issue description Hi, Pieces OS is working fine in VSCode (extension version: `v1.16.2`), until I load into a dev container. VSCode gives me these notifications: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/48d644e3-c170-4caf-8258-d96f2323c2cf) ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/a393edaf-8405-4581-9807-3ae093d078e3) Pieces explorer looks like this: # Attempted fixes I tried to turn off / disable macOS native firewall as well as [Lulu](https://objective-see.org/products/lulu.html) completely, but the issue still persists. Not sure how to make inbound firewall rule for port 1000 on macOS, where you need to specify an exact application associated with firewall rules. # One strange behavior Now, one thing is strange - **if PiecesOS is turned off before opening VSCode and I open a VSCode in dev container straight away, PiecesOS automatically starts and shows me the welcome window**: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/07cd8e60-1b29-4757-8204-c82d87cd39ce) Does it mean, that the VSCode extension inside dev container (i.e. docker container) can communicate with host and startup the application? If so, why does it fail to communicate further? ## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary **Key Points:** * The `Pieces` extension for VS Code was not able to connect to the Pieces OS instance. * The issue was caused by the extension needing to access Pieces OS via the `host.docker.internal` DNS name, which was not available when Pieces OS wasn't running. * A temporary solution was found by setting the `custom url` option in the extension settings. * A more permanent solution is being developed to automatically detect and connect to Pieces OS regardless of its state. **Problems Identified:** * The extension was unable to connect to Pieces OS by default. * The required DNS name was only available when Pieces OS was running. * Users needed to manually configure the extension to connect. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Setting the `custom url` option to `http://host.docker.internal:1000`. * Automatically detecting and connecting to Pieces OS regardless of its state. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The temporary solution using the `custom url` option is working. * The permanent solution is being developed and will be released in a future update. **Additional Notes:** * The user also suggested allowing users to specify multiple URLs in the `pieces.customUrl` setting. * The discussion also highlighted the need for better support for remote development environments. * A new notification on startup will inform users when a remote environment is detected and provide a link to the documentation.
